// better solution by spalmer here: http://shadertoy.com/view/ctffWl


#define rot(a)    mat2(cos(a+vec4(0,11,33,0)))                // rotation

void mainImage(out vec4 O, vec2 U)
{
    float t=9.,r,a;
    vec3  R = iResolution, z,
          D = normalize( vec3(U+U, -2.*R.y) - R ),            // ray direction
          p = vec3(0,0,12), q,P,                              // marching point along ray 
          C = iMouse.z > 0. ? 8.*iMouse.xyz/R -4.             // camera control
                          : 3.* cos(.3*iTime + vec3(0,11,0)); // demo mode
    for ( O=vec4(1); O.x > 0. && t > .01; O-=.005 )           // march scene
        q = p, 
        q.yz *= rot(-C.y),                                    // rotations
        q.xz *= rot(-C.x),
        r = length(q.yz), a = atan(q.x,r-4.),                                                       
        P = vec3( atan(q.z,q.y) , a , 0 ) /.628,              // surface parameterization 
        z = sin(fract(P)*.628-.314),                          // polygonalize 
        z = sqrt(1.+z*z),
        t = length(vec2( q.x, r - 4.*z.x )) - z.y,            // polygonal torus surface     
        p += .2*t*D;                                          // step forward = dist to obj  
 
    O *= O*O*O*2.;                                            // color scheme
 // P = floor(P), O *= .6 + .6 * cos( P.x+11.7*P.y  + vec4(0,23,21,0) ); // coloring quads
}
